definition: to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: In this suggestion, I target two kinds of potential stakeholders. One is sponsor;
sentences.chinese: 本建议案中，我将目标锁定为两群潜在的利害关系者。

sentences.english: The interest at stake of the intervenor appellant and the administrative appeal.
sentences.chinese: 二参加人与本诉愿之利害关系。

sentences.english: Mr Luo has a lot at stake.
sentences.chinese: 新规则对雒海超有很大的利害关系。

sentences.english: Too much is at stake if we fail.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们失败，涉及的利害关系太大。

sentences.english: "Logos He goes on. "But logos," he writes, " "serves to reveal the advantageous and the harmful.
sentences.chinese: 也继续写到，主要是为展露出利害关系。

sentences.english: We hope to hold the advantages and disadvantages of Chinese oil-painting influenced by the post-modernism current of thought .
sentences.chinese: 以期把握后现代主义思潮对中国油画产生的利害关系。

sentences.english: The judgement is often biased by interest.
sentences.chinese: 判断往往因利害关系而有偏差。

sentences.english: But there may be more at stake than national honor.
sentences.chinese: 但当中的利害关系不仅仅是民族荣誉。

sentences.english: Who has a stake in the neighborhood?
sentences.chinese: 谁在这个地区有利害关系？

sentences.english: Other research suggests that high stakes can befuddle the brain .
sentences.chinese: 另一项研究显示，高度的利害关系会让人头脑发昏。

sentences.english: So the stakes are very high.
sentences.chinese: 因此，利害关系很分明的。

sentences.english: Any other interested relationship that may affect the impartial enforcement of law.
sentences.chinese: 可能影响公正执法的其他利害关系。

sentences.english: I want to raise the stakes beyond using Mass. Ave.
sentences.chinese: 如果其中的利害关系，超越使用麻省的路。

sentences.english: This effect, with interest influence on the thoughts and feelings be roughly the same.
sentences.chinese: 这个影响，同利害关系对思想感情的影响不相上下。

definition: pros and cons/advantages and disadvantages/gains and losses
pros and cons/merits and drawbacks/advantages and disadvantages
lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
main content/matter/work/origin of an incident/cause/purpose/subject (of business letter)
cause and effects (idiom); entire process of development
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
